France Football: Messi earns €30m more than Cristiano Ronaldo

Leo Messi pocketed 126 million euros in gross earning over the 2017-18 season, according to figures collated by France Football, more than €30m more than Cristiano Ronaldo, who made €94m. The totals were reached taking into account salary before tax, bonuses and earnings through publicity and sponsorship.


Third in the list of highest-earners is PSG forward Neymar, who earned €81.5m, followed by Real Madrid forward Gareth Bale in fourth with €44m. Completing the top five is Barcelona defender Gerard Piqué, who banked €29m over the same period.

Messi has therefore regained top spot after relinquishing it to Ronaldo in 2016-17, when the Portuguese earned €87.5m to the Argentinean’s €76.5m.

France Football, which awards the annual Ballon d’Or, also stated that Messi’s earnings for the season made him the first footballer in history to break the €100m-mark in a single year.

Bale: "It's an honour to be linked with Bayern Munich"

Gareth Bale admitted in an interview with Germany's Sport Bild that he would like more playing time with Real Madrid.


Bale was also asked about a hypothetical move to the Bavarian side and confirmed: "In football you can never say never. I'm enjoying my football in Madrid and I admit that Bayern have always been one of the best sides in European football. To be linked with this club is an honor for any player but I'm a Real Madrid player"

Bale was also asked about a hypothetical move to the Bavarian side and confirmed: "In football you can never say never. I'm enjoying my football in Madrid and I admit that Bayern have always been one of the best sides in European football. To be linked with this club is an honor for any player but I'm a Real Madrid player"

REAL COMMITTED TO BENZEMA

Real Madrid president Florentino Perez remains committed to out-of-form striker Karim Benzema, according to Marca.

Following a light training session at the Allianz Arena on Tuesday night the Madrid chief reportedly greeted the French striker warmly and spoke at length with him about his recent tough run on the pitch.

CALDERON: KANE A REAL TARGET

Tottenham striker Harry Kane is a target for Real Madrid, according to the former president of the La Liga side.

"The objective for Real Madrid, no doubt, is Kane,” Ramon Calderon told The Sun.

“If they want a player for the next five or six years they are going to go for Kane but [Spurs chairman Daniel] Levy is going to ask a fortune for him.

"As far as I know, Tottenham is not willing to let him go but Bayern also say Lewandowski is not going anywhere.

"[Bayern chief executive Karl-Heinz] Rummenigge has said he can bet that he will be in Bayern next season but we have heard that so many times, and in my experience it is the player who has the final decision of where to go."
